WRITING.TEXT: Why risk injury? Keep good form.

No man. There is a 90 minute window, give or take, for you to get energy into your muscles. Don't listen to these other guys, if you wait more than that you will put your gains and recovery time at risk. You want to consume quick carbs straight after your work out, to release insulin to your blood which is a growth hormone. I got 12 kilos in 12 weeks by drinking 1 letre of water, 6 table spoons of glucose and a teaspoon of creatine straight after a work out. This isn't sustainable for a long time, so only do it for 8-12 weeks, or you risk getting diabetes. After that, consume a meal with regular carbs and protein and fats, then any meals after that should be Low GI foods, such as quinoa or fruits/nuts etc and tough to digest meats.
If you don't use it, you lose it. Keep a healthy, balanced diet and you will lose less, ofcourse.

Hey mate. I'd recommend going something like; Upper Body, Lower Body, Core, Cardio. This way you aren't over training anything, especially your rotator cuffs. Lift heavy, to increase muscle mass, which will in-turn raise your metabolic rate. Try to eat only low GI food until after you have trained, you can then eat some high GI foods straight after (in your 90 minute window) as those carbs will be used to help fuel muscle recovery and restore energy supplies. After your post-work out meal go back to low GI foods. Don't eat too close to bed time, because when you sleep your muscle recovery is fueled by burning fat. Feel free to ask any questions.
Work shoulders 3 times in 4 days? Sounds like a recipe for a rotator injury.
Bro... Go to the gym, of course you can go to the gym. Be safe and aware of what you can and can't do, and everything will be fine.

Chest works shoulders, Back works shoulders, Shoulders works shoulders. I don't think there is a reason to throw in the shoulders day, when he will be doing his shoulders on chest and back day. He will injure himself.

Sure, the delts will only be stabalisers in some of the exercises, but your 4 rotator cuffs can be easily over worked. I'm not saying it will happen but my experience as a personal trainer tells me not to train clients like this. EDIT: New clients*

This is because of your fight or flight responses and adrenaline. Your body thinks you're running for a reason, so it gets rid of everything in your body that doesn't need to be there, to help you in combat. People have been known to throw up as well.

Hey buddy, good on you for getting help instead of giving up! you will progress I promise you that.. If your goals are to gain muscle and lose body fat, stick to compound movements when you exercise, so recruiting more than 1 group of muscles, for example... Dumbell curl, isolated... Push-up, compound... (a good way to tell is if you're using more than 1 joint IE a squat uses knee and hip, they both flex and extend so it's compound, where as dumbell curl only uses elbow) this will burn most amount of energy. Also, if you're doing shoulders, make ure you aren't over working them, people get out there and go "oooohh I need a big back so i'll do a huge back day, oh i need a massive chest im doing chest day next... oh yeah now i need massive shoudlers, shoulder day is next"... Hello, you've worked your shoulders 3 days in a row... Even though you're doing a chest press you're still using your anterior delt, even though you're doing a seated row you're still using your posterior delts... Take a few days off, 4-7 days until they feel fine, then ease back into it, be sure to BREAK YOUR ROUTINES UP. I suggest for you if you're new in the gym, maybe do like... Upper body (chest,back,arms) lower body(legs) core and cardio, 4 days... That way everything is broken up nicely... You don't necessarily HAVE to smash your shoulders, chest and back will work them, but if you insist of OHP and training your shoulders, make sure your form is right. Ask me about proper form if you'd like... By doing compound exercises you disrupt more muscle which means you burn more energy at the time, and more muscle needs to repair over the next 2-3 days, raising your metabolic rate aswell, even throw in 20-30 minutes cardio after your session to burn extra weight. Don't go too intense though, stay at around 55%-75% intensity to maximise your weight loss
You'll be fine... Make sure you're eating the right foods, at the right times, and make sure your form is good, you will be okay. Feel free to ask me any questions.

If you want to gain muscle mass, you should be upping the weight. You want to only be able to JUST get out 10-12 reps on your first set... then say 10-11, 9-10 and so on, this will create the best hypertrophy. Also be sure to eat properly and at the right time. Feel free to ask for tips.

Hmm... Your abs are your abs, there is no top and bottom only left and right sides of your rectus abdominus muscles. You need to burn fat. Could I suggest changing your routine a little? Upper body, Lower body, Core, day off, repeat. Add 20-30 minutes of moderate intensity cardio just to burn a little extra weight after your strength training (Say, 60-70% intensity). Lay off any high GI foods until after you've trained (refer to this http://www.fitandfabforlife.us/uploads/1/2/5/6/12569263/4894854.png?696 High numbers = High GI. Predominantly you you want to eat low GI foods, except after training, because you need to carbs in fast to refuel your muscles and also to release insulin which is a growth hormone. Feel free to ask any questions.

3000 calories a day? that's 12000 kilojoules? Wow. Too many mate. Eat about 1500-2000, that should be plenty enough. Also, only eat high GI foods after training, predominantly you should be eating low GI foods through the day... This should give you some idea of what to eat. http://www.fitandfabforlife.us/uploads/1/2/5/6/12569263/4894854.png?696
No... It's not... Your BMR is probably 7000-ish kj that's what you need to live doing nothing... If you're consuming almost double that, you're going to put on weight, fast. Simple.

Okay. I don't see much reason for you to use your ATP/CP energy system, this is "gear 3" or your fast twitch fibers. You want to work anywhere from 1% to 80% intensity with your cardio, meaning a walk to a 3/4 pace jog (this varies depending on your fitness level, for some people a brisk walk could be 60% intensity, for some people a brisk walk is only 30% intensity, be honest with yourself as to how hard you are working out. I strongly recommend you to do some kind of weight's training, as it will increase your metabolic rate as well as burn fat while you train. The reason it will increase your metabolic rate is because of recovery. If it take 2-3 days for your muscles to stop hurting, that's 2-3 days of recovery. Your body requires energy to recover so it will burn fat. Your diet is also a big factor for you. You want to refrain from any high GI foods except for after you train, to replish energy supply to your muscles. Predominantly you want to eat low GI foods throughout the day. http://www.fitandfabforlife.us/uploads/1/2/5/6/12569263/4894854.png?696 Here is a glycemic index table, the higher the number next to a food type, the higher GI it is. You want to eat mostly low numbers. EDIT: Source - I'm a personal trainer. A good one.

Yeah, he's right... I'm a personal trainer myself, and I'd have to agree with him, you just get a better work out. Stabalisers are engaged, your core is more engaged, and you can't cheat by having a dominating hand take more of the load.

Yep, sweet. I got this covered. PT Student here. You sit infront of a computer all day, so you probably sit with rounded shoulders, giving you a tight chest and lengthened back muscles. Any beginner should just dedicate to 2-3 times a week, build a foundation of stability for their exercises by doing high reps of medium intensity say 60% of 1RM. After you have a solid foundation of this, and are able to work out 5-6 times a week without damaging anything or getting severe DOMS, you will progress into strength gaining, where your weight will increase and the reps will drop to about 8. You will stay at this weight until you can reach 12 reps of that weight, then increase it by 5-10%. You continue doing this until you are big as phuk. From strength training you can begin to go into power lifting, but it's another ball game entirely and you probably have no interest. PM or ask for more information on power lifting, have a good life, friend.

Uh, this is stupid. PT student here, and bench press is one of the most popular, most utilized chest exercises in the world for a reason. IT IS GOOD. It's compound, it's functional and it's simple. You will get a light weight when you start where you can do 12-15 reps for 3 sets, you will continue with this weight until you hit 20 reps for 3 sets. Then increase the weight to a point where you can only do 8-10 reps for 3 sets. You will continue with this weight until you can do 3 sets of 12, from there you will increase the weight by 5-10% every time you can do 3 sets of 12 of your new weight. This is safe, this is progressive, this is not dangerous at all. Your form will come into it but hey, the form for a bb benchpress is not very complicated, youtube it. It's DOMS - Delayed Onset Muscle Soreness. It peaks at 24-48 hours after your workout, it's fine. If you feel it is not in your muscles though, probably lay off heavy chest exercises until the pain stops, and lift lighter next time until you're stronger.

Well, I'm from Australia, and it's really kind of... I mean, I have seen all these work outs and I just don't really believe in them. Every single person has different goals, there is so many variations to what every person needs that I've never believed in a 1 program suits all sorta thing, I don't know that's just me personally. It's a good program though, don't get me wrong. If I were you though, I'd go back to Chest day/Back/Core/Legs/Rest/Repeat. I'd be doing your lifts at heavy enough to do 10-12 reps. So let's use bench press for example, get a weight you can only lift 10-12 times. Keep that weight, until you can reach 15 reps, you then increase the weight by 5-10% and repeat the process until you are big as fuck. Doing this will ensure that you are building muscle safely, you're progressing and growing in a safe, steady and measurable way. You will have good strength in all your stabilizer muscles and won't be at risk of injury.

Hey mate! Yeah it can get confusing, haha. Never mind, I will help you as much as I can :) If you were my client, I would go: Chest Day. Back Day. Core. Legs. Cardio. Repeat. As for sodium and sugar, don't bother counting, just don't have any where possible :) Try to not buy packaged or processed foods, and you'll be okay. For your program, you want more upperbody sets, than lower body sets, but you want your chest day relatively equal in sets to your back day. You will get your weights heavy enough to do 10-12 reps, you'll keep that weight on that exercise until you can do 15 reps, then you'll increase the weight by 5-10%. This will guarantee you steady, safe progression and will decrease the likelyhood of injury. Youtube and Google all your exercises before you use them. Google terms such as "Top 10 chest exercises" or "Best leg exercises" to make your program with. Here's a hint though, if a exercise sounds really fancy and difficult, it's probably trash. Stick to the good, compound exercises (compound means more than 1 muscle group is being used) like a good old fashioned squat, or bench press.

Yeah, awesome. I'd do a 4 day split, Chest, Back, Legs, Core. I'd train in the morning at the gym, and do a 20-30 minute body weight HIIT circuit at home. That would help ensure you continue to grow muscle, which will increase your metabolism etc to help you lose weight, as well as the HIIT to burn extra energy.

Hey, if you were my client I'd have you doing a strength program. They not only burn energy, but you will continue to burn energy afterwards because you need to repair from it. Also you get bigger muscles, so you will burn more energy everyday just from that, too. Men or women, both should train with weights. I know a lot of women are scared of them because they don't want to get huge, but you won't... Not easily. You don't have the testosterone levels to get that big. Also, stop drinking the protein shakes and just source your protein from meats/nuts/vege's etc. You should definitely eat fruit, please eat fruit. Eating fruit won't make you fat. Just stay away from packaged/processed foods, eat clean, train mean, you will lose your love handles :) edit: you should do a little cardio as well, but strength training is important.

You should reach muscle failure at 12 reps, that's the weight you need. You should do that 3-4 times. A beginner would do it 1-2 times (sets). And I don't see much point in exercising longer than 45-60 minutes for the every day person. There is reasons people would need to train more, but they are usually athletes or something.

It's all based on science, lol. Yes, all the information I learned was up to date. I'm employed at SnapFitness, at a club in Australia. Every 2 years we have to have accumulated 100 CEC points, the points are acquired by completing courses etc in fitness, be it even something simple like a kettle bell short course.

Oh, excellent. Such great news to hear you are going to start training, how exciting for you :D I would start off with 2 full body hypertrophy sessions and 2 circuit days, and walk for 30 minutes around your block or something 5-6 days a week :) Leg Press Push-Up Lat PullDown Bridge Lunge Machine Chest Press Cable Row Leg Raises That could be your exercises for your full body work out twice a week. You'd do 2 sets of them, and have the weight so you can do about 12-15 reps, so, you want your leg press to be heavy enough so you can only push it up 12-15 times before you can't do it again. You will have to find this weight with trial and error, same with all the other ones. If you can't do a push-up on your toes, then do it on your knee's, if you can't do it on your knee's, then lean against a wall, or a bench and pushup off that. When you can do the exercise with say 15-18 reps, you need to increase the weight by about 5-10% so you can only do 12-15. Doing 12-15 reps will build stabilisation, in 6 weeks you want to change the weight so you can do 10-12 reps instead of so high of reps/ Sorry, this was a lot to take in, do you have a question?

EDIT: Lifting weights like this will build muscle, which will increase your metabolism to aid in weight loss, it will also help to tighten and tone. Girls don't really end up massive, you don't have enough testosterone, so it's very hard to get massive.

Some people just genetically have higher fat stores over their stomach than others. What you could do though, is some weighted core exercises. So, crunches or sit ups with a plate/medicine ball, renegade rows etc to build your rectus abdominus which is your 6 pack. Doing a ton of sit ups won't give you a 6 pack because the reps are too high, it's endurance training for your abs not muscle building.

Yeah so, I was thinking some kind of interval circuit. Buy yourself some Dumbells, they don't have to be too heavy. Squat, push-up, crunch, mountain climbers, lunge, reverse DB fly's, bridge and burpee's. 30 seconds on 20 seconds rest, at the end of the 8, you rest for 1 minute and do it 3 times. Should be about a 20 minute work out at a reasonable intensity, you can add more seconds to the work so 40 on 20 off or u can take some off 20 on 20 off to make it less or more intense. That may or may not be a good circuit for you, I haven't had much of a chance to talk to you, but you seem healthy and didn't mention any serious health conditions so I'd say use it if you please, if you can't get dumbells, instead of reverse flys or rows just google a replacement bodyweight exercise for your back.
Great, best of luck :) PM me if anything comes up or just ask here again.

I would say, higher reps and lower rest, but when your repa get too high you need to add weight.

WRITING.TEXT: As long as your body is getting enough carbs to keep up with muscle repair and to keep you functioning normal you're fine. Getting enough protein in your diet is incredibly easy, focus on carbs.
Carbs is just as important as protein. Protein is literally just bricks, they are useless building blocks without carbs to put them together.
Thanks a lot me and my girlfriend just read it and we enjoyed it :)
Thanks a lot that was cool! :)

October? That's 10 months away. You can be doing 50+ of both of them by that time. Keep doing the chin-ups, it will grow your bi's. As for the pull-ups, trying getting up, by jumping or something, then lowering down over a 4-5 second period, these are called 'negatives' and although this is training in an eccentric phase (going down), it will give you gains for your concentric phase (going up). Train again as soon as you no longer have DOMS, if you reach a plateau and stop getting DOMS, just train twice a day.

Training with DOMS isn't a very good idea. It may or may not be safe to train with them, but also, your muscles are not fully repaired and will not train at 100% and if they can't train at 100% there is no progression. You will train one day, the next your muscles are fatigued at 50% their capacity in strength, the next day they are sore at 85% then they are 100% but you wait 1 more day after they are recovered, because they are super compensated at this stage. So they did x reps, then they get stronger so they don't go under that much stress again, your body adapts. So you want to train within this period, you don't want to train with DOMS, and you don't want to train too long after they are gone either. You want to train when they are super compensated and can perform at 100% or you're not getting the most out of your training.
You need to hit your right carbs too man, carbs is what fuels your muscle repair. Protein is nothing but building blocks and then you need carbs to do all the labour to put them together.

Hey mate, sounds like you need to stretch, and you can use a foam roller to help as well, just use youtube to find how to use it properly. Also, remember that your bones and tendons need to get gains as well. The rest of your muscles might condition really fast compared to them, that could be the reason why you're in pain. Make sure you're progressing at a safe pace.

Just do body weight stuff man, until you can find yourself in a better situation to lift heavy weights. Variations of push-ups, chin-ups, pull-ups, a ton of core exercises, work out at the local parks, squats, lunges, jump lunges, jumping squats, side squats... There is a ton of things you can do with your body weight to get ripped and look good.
Why don't you just eat properly, so you don't need to take supplements. EAT CLEAN, TRAIN MEAN!
What, you can't actually believe that, can you? A crunch only uses the rectus abdominus, where a plank uses the entire core...

When you do a crunch it's an isolated exercise, meaning it targets 1 specific muscle. This muscle is the rectus abdominus, or your 'abs'. When you do a bridge, you activate your entire core. That is why a bridge is better, because it activates more muscles, and gives you a better work out, where crunches don't do much at all except strain your back.

Sorry, it's you that has misinformation. [Here](http://imgur.com/FhGfA10) is a graph I drew for you on how super compensation works. DOMS is a very clear indication that your muscles are still fatigued, and training with fatigued muscles means you can't lift to 100% of your capacity. You should wait until your muscles are repaired and super compensated before training those muscles again, to ensure you get the most out of your workouts. EDIT: Also, after the person is able to do 12 or more pull-ups the risk of injury etc dramatically decreases so you may be able to get away with it. Below this though, and they are essentially doing hypertrophy training, and NEED rest. Once they're over 12 reps they are basically doing endurance training, so they will have a way lower risk.

Um, legs (especially glutes in this instance) can easily be fatigued for a week lol. They are probably the only muscles that can be fatigued for that long though. That isn't what I said at all, DOMS is an indication of fatigue, fatigue isn't indicated by DOMS. You don't need DOMS to be fatigued, lol. If you are fatigued, you do not and can not perform at 100%, if you cannot perform at your peak you will not reach your potential, because you will not your muscles as much as it could have. Fact.

If you're doing less than 12 reps it is not endurance, it's hypertrophy... If you're doing hypertrophy, you need rest. I said before, if you're able to do high reps, you can probably train more often. EDIT: Also, I reached a plateau a few years ago, doing push-ups. I was doing 500ish in a session, and couldn't find a way to bust out a single rep more, some days I couldn't even get up to it, my range was like 470-500. It came down to rest time. I found with a rest, day, instead of doing pushups every single day, I was able to break my plateau.
Most of the core.

Sitting down all day will lengthen your glutes and weaken them and tighten your hamstrings, it will put your posture way out of whack. Look man, all I'm saying is that considering you're only training your rectus abdominus for endurance by doing crunches, I think they're stupid. The only way they would be good is doing them weighted, because they will actually give you aesthetics like a 6 pack. Doing a bridge will train most of your core instead of isolating the 1 muscle, but again, a bridge is also better weighted.

I'm aware of that, but there is way more training in the CP energy system at 1-8 reps. You are training to gain muscle mass. at 12+ you are mainly training your muscles to remove lactic acid and to get higher reps, you don't need bigger muscles from then on so they just won't grow(much). If they are hitting the same muscle groups groups 4/5 times a week you can guarantee there is not very much weight.

Yeah man, myfitnesspal is the best one I know for that stuff, and yeah definitely need to lift. It will increase your metabolism heaps, because of the muscle recovery and also will give you a bigger daily intake of calories because of the increase in muscle size, which will make it easier to burn fat.

You can easily do 20 pull-ups by the end of the year. You can either do a ton of negatives, so getting yourself up by jumping or a friend, then lowering yourself over 4-5 seconds. This is training in the eccentric phase (down) but it still gives you gains for concentric (up). You can also find an assisted pull-ups machine, which will also help. EDIT: Realistically, the best chance for you to be able to reach your goal, is to lose weight. Watch your caloric intake by using myfitnesspal or something, and also do some hypertrophy training and also cardio training.
Core exercises won't burn fat, lol. Lifting weights and cardio is how you lose fat.

You need to lift weights. I strongly recommend you do some kind of a hypertrophy program to help you build muscle and get stronger, don't worry though you won't end up muscly like a man, females generally don't have enough testosterone. Obviously you still need to do cardio too though, so maybe do cardio 5 days a week and lift weights 3 days a week (perhaps 3 full body work outs, or upperbody then lowerbody then core, the days can also overlap.

You're right, sorry. You can't spot reduce fat, if you want to lose fat, it comes from everywhere equally, you can't choose where. The best way to lose weight is to recruit muscle mass, so lifting heavy weights with compound exercises, also doing cardio will burn fat aswell. I like hypertrophy because it builds muscle, which means it costs more energy for your body to live every day cause it's bigger, so you have a higher metabolism. That means it's easier to lose weight, but cardio is equally important.

If you're feeling tired, fatigued, slugging during your days, struggling to get out of bed and under performing when you train, you're probably over doing it. If your energy levels are still high, you can focus and feel alright, then you can continue. Try not to train muscle groups if they still have DOMS, you need to let everything repair. You could also get some vitamin D and calcium supplements if you wanted, just to assist your leg bones etc while you're easing into the jogging/running. EDIT: I notice you're doing Ab ripper, I can only imagine that's because you want a 6 pack, which is fine. While you're trying to lose weight though, you should probably just focus on doing large compound exercises, so you can maximise your fat burning and increase your metabolism as much as possible.

Hypertrophy is the name of the type of training you do to build muscle mass and strength. It's heavy, you can only usually lift the weight 6-12 times. EDIT: As a beginner, you want to have it around 12 reps, so heavy enough that you can only, say, do a bench press 12 times. This is because it's safest for you, then you'd continue with that weight til you could do 15 reps with 2 sets, and you'd increase 5-10% weight, to drop you back to 12. As you get stronger, you could drop the reps and increase the weight, so you can do say 8-10 bench press reps, but you do it the way I said first, so that you can build stabiliser muscles etc, so you don't have 120KG swaying uncontrollably above your face.
Sure, no problem. Let me know if you ever need help, I'm always happy to help out :)
Yeah, nothing wrong with it, but you can also just eat more. I'd rather just eat more, but each to their own.

WRITING.TEXT: In Australia, Winter has just begun.

"F**king nut case" Kelso yells after the Taxi, as it screams off sideways collecting a street bin in it's path. After a few steps, in god knows which direction, he also notices he's covered to his thighs in mud and water, which the taxi driver basically threw him in to, after seeing the birth-mark on his neck. He usually covers it with a scarf or his jumper, but it was an unusually thick, hot, muggy night. He thought to himself on his way out "Who'd notice it at this time of night anyway?" He stopped leaving the house without covering it unless he *had* to, at about the age of 13, this was when he hit high school. One of the teachers went crazy on his 3rd day.. He earned the nickname 'The Chosen One' which is a direct English translation from 'Alesul' - The teacher was screaming it at him, after seeing the birthmark. Apparently also trying to burn it into his skin during wood works with Pyrography tool. This was his favorite new subject up until this day. Rest assured the teacher was put on sick leave and admitted to a psychiatric ward, but the kids never forgot. After beseeching the directions home from a clerk at a nearby 24 hour shop, he started trudging home in the once again, pouring rain. After battling the elements and traffic for about 15 blocks, he finally knew where he was again. "It might be a sh*t day, but thank f*ck I can follow directions" he was thinking to himself, as he passed another dank back alley. It was then that he heard the name 'Alesul" come eerily from the alley way. Kelso stood frozen, the hairs prickling on the back of his neck, beads of sweat trickling down his spine and nose like ice. He took a few steps back to get a decent look down this alley way, and saw nothing notable.. He stared for a few seconds before turning to leave "Everyone has given you sh*t about this birthmark since you were a kid... It looks like a dragon, sure, but it's just a great coincidence. I can guarantee you, stranger things have happened, than a dude being born with a birthmark that resembles a dragon" Now turning, and taking the first of his last hundred or so steps home, he see's in the corner of his eyesight, the bright red glare of a pair of eyes. Not regular eyes though, they were sharp, jagged. Fuck the shape, they are the size of footballs! After what must be only a few seconds later, he hears the gushing of wind. The sound belting his ears, like long slow drums, slowely fading... He gets to his feet, and runs! "My legs are so sore... No they're numb.. How much longer can my body keep sprinting? I thought home was closer than this?" He ran as far as he can, "I'm at my limit.. But my front door is just there!.. I can make it!" he says to himself as he pants, grudgingly dragging numb, dead legs toward it while gasping for air, taking in long draws of the icey cold air which is hurting his lungs and throat. He collapses on the ground, suprisingly not due to exhaustion, rather he was forced down by another gush of wind. This time it was not the sound but the force of the gush itself. He hits the ground hard, seeing stars. He slowly raises his head, and through the pouring down rain, sound of traffic in the distance and through the ringing in his own head from clashing it against the concrete, he see's this big dark figure with crimson red eyes, and shining teeth the size of your arm.. It stares at him before hissing "I've found you Alesul"

WRITING.TEXT: NSFW huh? Is that cause you have an 'outtie'?

"Yeah, well when she slept with Jerry, I really thought she was a bitch, so I made sure to kill her in as gruesome way as possible" Death chuckled to me over the phone "People picture me as this really horrible emotionless dude who just goes around killing people, but I have a job man. You humans won't stop fucking so if I don't do my job, shit get's real" Well that's true, there is already 7 billion of us. "Anyway, meet me at the usual place it's about time we catch up, 7pm don't be late or you're dead" What the fuck? "AHHH I'm just kidding Paulie, you know I wouldn't kill you buddy, cya then" Death says cordially before hanging up the phone to me. Wouldn't kill me? Bullshit. You've given up on trying because I'm too smart for you, you hooded bag of bones. There was a lot of close calls though, I'm glad you finally gave up old friend. As I push open the old wooden saloon doors, and take my first few steps from the aching heat of the sun, I feel instant relief. Walking along the dark dusty floorboards, soaking up the coolness of the shady room, I pass a few shady characters sitting at tables whispering among themselves, but I walk passed with no problem. I get to the bar and take a seat on the stool, grab a glass of whisky on the rocks and start sipping away, waiting for my friend. After some time of listening to drunks have conversations and a fight nearly breaking out, I hear the familiar sound of the saloon doors swinging open. I look back to see the hooded figure sweeping across the room and then sit up the back in the darkest area of the pub. He beckons me over with the wave of his boney hand and I signal him 2 fingers for 2 minutes. I had to piss. I come back from the bathroom and Death is reseating himself at a different location with 2 more drinks for us both. I take my drink up from the bar and position myself in the seat next to him. Time passes as we talk about things catching up, death telling me stories of the funny ways he has had to bring people to their fateful end, and me laughing giving him idea's on what to do next. Death nudges a drink toward me and says "Here take a sip" "Nah I've had enough, I should really get going soon pal. We can't drink like the old days I have a family now". At this Death get's a little excitable, and really urges me to have a drink "Just one more drink come on please, one more drink just have a sip, just have one sip buddy for old time sakes" I look at him with curiosity and oblige. I take a sip. "YES! I've DONE IT! After 20 fucking years I got this little punk bitch! Ever since he was a fucking teenager this asshole has been eluding me and out smarting me!! I knew the only way to get him was to trick him in to thinking I liked him." The mortal looks me in the eyes with pure desperation as he is clearly struggling to breath. Ahhh I love that sound, you know that sound when someone is gasping for air? They are kind of wheezing as the air whistles in and out of their swelling wind pipe? "I... Thought we were friends" the idiot says to me as he makes his last ever hand grip on my sweet hood. He falls to the ground and now all I have to do is escort this suckers soul to the other side. I earned a drink. I sit back in my chair, twirling a shot glass in my boney finger tips smirking at how smart I am, better knock back this shot and get back to work. "Idiot" Paulie thinks to himself, as he looks over the hooded figure while sipping down the last of his poisonous shot glass. "I told you not to fuck with me, now death is the one that is dead" "Probably should of kept a closer eye on me if you're going to poison me, instead of getting caught up bragging about killing people and looking around for victims, you make me sick." Out of no-where the lights go dim, and everything around him stops moving. Mid conversation, people are frozen. A jug of beer a drunk man had clearly knocked over, frozen in the air. An ominous sound resenonates from deep within my head, and my skin begins to shrink and dry up, everything turns from colour to grey. In a frantic panic, I stumble to my feet and sprint toward the toilet knocking bins and chairs over in my path. Busting the door open, I run to the sink and peer into the empty, hollow eyes on my face. Draped in a jet black material not of this world was my skeletal figure, *I am now death.*
Thanks, I've only done 1 other about a year ago. It was fun writing it.

Forcefully? No. That's a terrible way to put it. "12 Stepping" is just alcoholics coming in and talking with your friend about themselves, their alcoholic issues and how they drank, who they were and where they were going. They also talk about where they are now that they are blessed with sobriety and how they achieved it, if your friend wants the same life as them then he will be willing to make "the steps" to get there. You either do The 12 Steps like millions of other alcoholics have done to achieve sobriety, or you don't and sadly probably die (Or other unfortunate circumstances i.e homeless, prison, broken family) like so, so many millions more. No one can force you to get sober, anyone with decent sobriety can clarify this for me. You can lead a camel to water, but you can't force it to drink.

Unless he is willing to take steps to change there is basically nothing you can do. The alcoholic has to want sobriety, it doesn't matter what anyone else thinks, he probably isn't even aware the alcohol is the problem (I know myself, and many others were not aware for a long time). Maybe when she leaves him or he hits some other kind of rock bottom like hospital or a prison he will admit he needs help, I'm so sorry. Also, it's not your fault. The approach you took is the best you knew how, you did all you knew how to do and that shows you cared. Unfortunately caring is not always enough. This is one of those sad things that happens to millions, you're not alone in this scenario and how it played out. Perhaps try going to some Alanon meetings. They are like AA meetings, but for people who have suffered living with the alcoholic, it can be very stressful and can really take it's toll on you. It would be good for you to understand what happened and what to do from here.

WRITING.TEXT: "2 Radio show hosts" I thought to myself - "I bet it's Hamish and Andy".

Started drinking by age 16, a couple of months before my 18th birthday I was in Max Security Jail. Small crime spree's while drunk and on benders consumed my life for the better part of the next 10 years. My brother and myself were arguing over who gets to drive his car to this party we're going to. Anyway, long story short, he falls out the window and I run him over, broke his ankle. To me, this was just me hurting my brother and fucking his legs up. I definitely felt bad, but at the same time it wasn't my fault and he knew that, too. This seemingly small event (On a scale against everything else I've done) speared me towards a rehab centre, because jail is boring and I didn't want to go back. From there my life changed from trying to get out of going to jail to being on a road of recovery. I had a couple of small slips, but I'm now almost 3 years clean and sober.

WRITING.TITLE: I don't wake up when I fall/hit the ground in dreams, AMA!

WRITING.TEXT: I always continue to dream. For a brief time (sometimes, not always) the dream becomes lucid and I control the dream before it blends into a normal dream where I spectate. EDIT: The impact is pain free, if that's what you're wondering. I just hit the ground like a pancake and stand-up.

The lucidity begins during the excitement. Say I'm on a ride at a themepark, and the bolts start coming loose. I start getting those feelings of free falling in my belly (Which I fucking love, mind you). It's when the bolts come loose, or I'm staring off the edge of a cliff. When the butterfly's begin the dream is mine.
No. I used to wake up as a small kid, then it changed to 50% of the time and it just slowely stopped happening. I finally stopped waking up at about 13-14.
Nope. I like the falling dreams, I love the feeling of free falling. Also I don't have to bother getting out of bed to pee and try to get back to sleep.

WRITING.TITLE: Well, that escalated quickly.

WRITING.TEXT: No, Nutrigrain Bars are nothing like the cereal.
Most morning I can wake up and tell someone what my dreams were about (Probably 90% of the time). I always remember lucid dreaming in very clear detail though.

That's a negative. I always seem to know I'm dreaming and that nothing happens when I hit the ground so I enjoy the butterflies you get from falling. I love those butterflies you get when you drop, or are on a ride at an amusement park, or bungee jumping.

Do you guys have any suggestions on flowers I can use and how to grow them please I have no idea what I'm doing and really need help to brighten my loves life a bit, she's in a dark place living with a level 7-8 pain ever day and somtimes can't even walk... Pls Reddit.
